maml:description.maml:para: Get Datto BCDR agents from a given device
The Get-DattoAgent cmdlet get agents from a given BCDR device
/bcdr/Agent - Does not return data /bcdr/device/serialNumber/Asset/Agent
Can also gets a list of your clients and the agents under those clients. As of 2022-04 this endpoint does not return any data.
Defines the BCDR serial number to get agents from
The parameter is mandatory
Defines the page number to return
The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
Defines the BCDR serial number to get agents from
The parameter is mandatory
Defines the page number to return
The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters

maml:alert.maml:para: The /agent uri does NOT return any data as this appears to be a deprecated endpoint in the Datto API. The /asset/agent DOES return data.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a list of clients and the agents under those clients.
As of 2022-04 this endpoint does not return any data. Leaving this here in the event Datto corrects this endpoint.
Returns the agents from the defined Datto BCDR
Returns the first 10 agents from page 2 from the defined Datto BCDR

maml:description.maml:para: Gets Datto BCDR alerts for a given device.
The Get-DattoAlert cmdlet gets Datto BCDR alerts for a given device.
Defines the BCDR serial number to get
The parameter is mandatory
Defines the page number to return
The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
Defines the BCDR serial number to get
The parameter is mandatory
Defines the page number to return
The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters

maml:alert.maml:para: PerPage always gets set to 100 regardless of value, appears this is not a valid parameter for this endpoint.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the Datto BCDR with the defined serialNumber and returns any alerts.
Gets the Datto BCDR with the defined serialNumber with the first 10 alerts from the 2nd page of results.

maml:description.maml:para: Get Datto BCDR assets (agents and shares) for a given device
The Get-DattoAsset cmdlet gets Datto BCDR assets (agents and shares) for a given device
Defines the BCDR serial number to get
The parameter is mandatory
Defines the page number to return
The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
Defines the BCDR serial number to get
The parameter is mandatory
Defines the page number to return
The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the Datto BCDR with the defined serialNumber and returns any agents or shares.
Gets the Datto BCDR with the defined serialNumber and returns the first 10 agents or shares from the 2nd page of results.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets Datto BCDR devices and assets
The Get-DattoBCDR cmdlet gets Datto BCDR devices and assets by combing all endpoints into a single command.
This unique function does not contain any Reporting or SaaS endpoints. This function was added to simply testing & generating reports
Returns a list of BCDR clients and the agents under those clients
As of 2022-04 this endpoint always returns no data
Endpoint = /bcdr/agent
Defines the page number to return
The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
Returns a list of BCDR devices registered under your portal
Endpoint = /bcdr/device
Whether hidden devices should be included in your results
Acceptable values are: '0', '1'
By default '1' is returned by the API which shows hidden devices.
Whether child reseller devices should be included in your results
Acceptable values are: '0', '1'
By default '1' is returned by the API which shows child reseller devices.
Defines the page number to return
The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
Returns a single BCDR device registered under your portal
Endpoint = /bcdr/device/{serialNumber}
Defines the BCDR serial number to get information from
The parameter is mandatory if you want to get a specific device.
Returns a list BCDR agents from a given device
Endpoint = /bcdr/device/{serialNumber}/asset/agent
Defines the BCDR serial number to get information from
The parameter is mandatory if you want to get a specific device.
Defines the page number to return
The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
Returns a list BCDR alerts from a given device
Endpoint = /bcdr/device/{serialNumber}/alert
Defines the BCDR serial number to get information from
The parameter is mandatory if you want to get a specific device.
Defines the page number to return
The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
Returns a list BCDR agents & shares from a given device
Endpoint = /bcdr/device/{serialNumber}/asset
Defines the BCDR serial number to get information from
The parameter is mandatory if you want to get a specific device.
Defines the page number to return
The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
Returns a list BCDR shares from a given device
Endpoint = /bcdr/device/{serialNumber}/asset/share

The parameter is mandatory if you want to get a specific device.

The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100

When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
Returns a list BCDR volumes from a given device
Endpoint = /bcdr/device/{serialNumber}/asset/volume
Defines the BCDR serial number to get information from
The parameter is mandatory if you want to get a specific device.

The Get-DattoDevice cmdlet gets can get a one or more Datto BCDR devices.
/bcdr/device - Returns all BCDR devices /bcdr/device/serialNumber - Returns a single BCDR device

The parameter is mandatory if you want to get a specific device.

Acceptable values are: '0', '1'
By default '1' is returned by the API which shows hidden devices.
Whether child reseller devices should be included in your results
Acceptable values are: '0', '1'
By default '1' is returned by the API which shows child reseller devices.

The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters

maml:alert.maml:para: Setting some parameters to an [INT] causes them to not be added to the body. (Show*Devices) Documentation around the Show* endpoints just defines that an integer is accepted. In testing only 0 or 1 appear to do anything.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the first 100 Datto BCDR devices with any hidden or child reseller devices.
Gets the first 100 Datto BCDR devices without any hidden or child reseller devices.
Gets the first 10 Datto BCDR devices from the second page. Hidden and child reseller devices will be included.

The Get-DattoVolume cmdlet gets an asset(s)(agent or share) for a specific volume on a device

The parameter is mandatory

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the Datto BCDR with the defined serialNumber and returns any agents or shares for the defined volume.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the API public & secret keys used to authenticate API calls.
The Add-DattoAPIKey cmdlet sets the API public & secret keys which are used to authenticate all API calls made to Datto.
Once the API public & secret keys are defined, the secret key is encrypted using SecureString.
The Datto API public & secret keys are generated via the Datto portal at Admin > Integrations
Defines your API public key.
Defines your API secret key.
Defines your API public key.
Defines your API secret key.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prompts to enter in the API public key and secret key.
The Datto API will use the string entered into the [ -Api_Key_Public ] parameter as the public key & will then prompt to enter in the secret key.
The Datto API will use the string entered as the secret key & will prompt to enter in the public key.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the base URI for the Datto API connection.
The Add-DattoBaseURI cmdlet sets the base URI which is later used to construct the full URI for all API calls.
Define the base URI for the Datto API connection using Datto's URI or a custom URI.
Datto's URI connection point that can be one of the predefined data centers.
The accepted values for this parameter are: [ US ] US = https://api.datto.com/v1
Placeholder for other data centers.
Define the base URI for the Datto API connection using Datto's URI or a custom URI.
Datto's URI connection point that can be one of the predefined data centers.
The accepted values for this parameter are: [ US ] US = https://api.datto.com/v1
Placeholder for other data centers.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The base URI will use https://api.datto.com/v1 which is Datto's default URI.
The base URI will use https://api.datto.com/v1 which is Datto's US URI.
A custom API gateway of http://myapi.gateway.example.com will be used for all API calls to Datto's API.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts uri filter parameters
The Invoke-ApiRequest cmdlet converts & formats uri filter parameters from a function which are later used to make the full resource uri for an API call
This is an internal helper function the ties in directly with the Invoke-ApiRequest & any public functions that define parameters
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.
This allows for the full uri query to occur
Defines the short resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.
This allows for the full uri query to occur
Defines the short resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call

dev:remarks.maml:para: Example: (From public function) $uri_Filter = @{}
ForEach ( $Key in $PSBoundParameters.GetEnumerator() ){ if( $excludedParameters -contains $Key.Key ){$null} else{ $uri_Filter += @{ $Key.Key = $Key.Value } } }
1x key = https://api.datto.com/v1/account?accountId=12345 2x key = https://api.datto.com/v1/account?accountId=12345&details=True

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the Datto BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to file.
The Export-DattoModuleSettings cmdlet exports the Datto BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to file.

Making use of PowerShell's System.Security.SecureString type, exporting module settings encrypts your API key in a format that can only be unencrypted with the your Windows account as this encryption is tied to your user principal. This means that you cannot copy your configuration file to another computer or user account and expect it to work.
Define the location to store the Datto configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI
Define the name of the Datto configuration file.
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Define the location to store the Datto configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI
Define the name of the Datto configuration file.
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Validates that the BaseURI, API, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's Datto configuration file located at: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI\config.psd1
Validates that the BaseURI, API, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's Datto configuration file located at: C:\DattoAPI\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the Datto API public & secret key global variables.
The Get-DattoAPIKey cmdlet gets the Datto API public & secret key global variables and returns them as an object.
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text.
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the Datto API public & secret key global variables and returns them as an object with the secret key as a SecureString.
Gets the Datto API public & secret key global variables and returns them as an object with the secret key as plain text.

maml:description.maml:para: Shows the Datto base URI global variable.
The Get-DattoBaseURI cmdlet shows the Datto base URI global variable value.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows the Datto base URI global variable value.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the saved Datto configuration settings
The Get-DattoModuleSettings cmdlet gets the saved Datto configuration settings from the local system.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI
Define the location to store the Datto configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI
Define the name of the Datto configuration file.
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Opens the Datto configuration file
Define the location to store the Datto configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI
Define the name of the Datto configuration file.
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Opens the Datto configuration file

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the contents of the configuration file that was created with the Export-DattoModuleSettings
The default location of the Datto configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI\config.psd1
Opens the configuration file from the defined location in the default editor
The location of the Datto configuration file in this example is: C:\DattoAPI\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Gets various Api metadata values
The Get-InvokeMetaData cmdlet gets various Api metadata values from an Invoke-WebRequest to assist in various troubleshooting scenarios such as rate-limiting.
Define the base URI for the Datto API connection using Datto's URI or a custom URI.
The default base URI is https://api.datto.com/v1
Define the base URI for the Datto API connection using Datto's URI or a custom URI.
The default base URI is https://api.datto.com/v1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets various Api metadata values from an Invoke-WebRequest to assist in various troubleshooting scenarios such as rate-limiting.
The default full base uri test path is: https://api.datto.com/v1
Gets various Api metadata values from an Invoke-WebRequest to assist in various troubleshooting scenarios such as rate-limiting.
The full base uri test path in this example is: http://myapi.gateway.example.com/device

maml:description.maml:para: Imports the Datto BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to the current session.
The Import-DattoModuleSettings cmdlet imports the Datto BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information stored in the Datto configuration file to the users current session.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI
Define the location to store the Datto configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI
Define the name of the Datto configuration file.
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Define the location to store the Datto configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI
Define the name of the Datto configuration file.
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-DattoModuleSettings cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session.
The default location of the Datto configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI\config.psd1
Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-DattoModuleSettings cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session.
The location of the Datto configuration file in this example is: C:\DattoAPI\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Makes an API request
The Invoke-ApiRequest cmdlet invokes an API request to Datto API.
This is an internal function that is used by all public functions
As of 2023-08 the Datto v1 API only supports GET requests
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'GET'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Used with the internal function [ ConvertTo-QueryString ] to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $Datto_Base_URI + $resource_Uri + ConvertTo-QueryString
Place holder parameter to use when other methods are supported by the Datto v1 API
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'GET'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Used with the internal function [ ConvertTo-QueryString ] to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $Datto_Base_URI + $resource_Uri + ConvertTo-QueryString
Place holder parameter to use when other methods are supported by the Datto v1 API
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters

Example: Name Value ---- ----- Method GET Uri https://api.datto.com/v1/account?accountId=12345&details=True Headers {Authorization = Bearer 123456789} Body

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the Datto API public & secret key global variables.
The Remove-DattoAPIKey cmdlet removes the Datto API public & secret key global variables.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

The Remove-DattoBaseURI cmdlet removes the Datto base URI global variable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the Datto base URI global variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the stored Datto configuration folder.
The Remove-DattoModuleSettings cmdlet removes the Datto folder and its files. This cmdlet also has the option to remove sensitive Datto variables as well.
By default configuration files are stored in the following location and will be removed: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI
Define the location of the Datto configuration folder.
By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI
Define if sensitive Datto variables should be removed as well.
By default the variables are not removed.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Define the location of the Datto configuration folder.
By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI
Define if sensitive Datto variables should be removed as well.
By default the variables are not removed.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Checks to see if the default configuration folder exists and removes it if it does.
The default location of the Datto configuration folder is: $env:USERPROFILE\DattoAPI
Checks to see if the defined configuration folder exists and removes it if it does. If sensitive Datto variables exist then they are removed as well.
The location of the Datto configuration folder in this example is: C:\DattoAPI

maml:description.maml:para: Test the Datto API public & secret keys.
The Test-DattoAPIKey cmdlet tests the base URI & API public & secret keys that were defined in the Add-DattoBaseURI & Add-DattoAPIKey cmdlets.

The default base URI is https://api.datto.com/v1/bcdr

The default base URI is https://api.datto.com/v1/bcdr

The full base uri test path in this example is: http://myapi.gateway.example.com/device

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a filtered list of activity logs ordered by date
The Get-DattoActivityLog cmdlet gets a filtered list of activity logs ordered by date
Defines a client name with which to do a partial/prefix match
2022-04: Filter does not appear to work
Defines the number of days (unless overridden with sinceUnits), up until now, for which to produce logs
Default value : 1
Defines the units to use for the since filter
Available values : days, hours, minutes
Default value : days
Defines a comma-separated array of targetType:targetId tuples
Example: bcdr-device:DC1234DC1234
2022-04: Only works with 1 item in the array right now (See Notes)
Defines the type of target for which to find activity logs
Example : bcdr-device
Defines a username with which to do a partial/prefix match
Defines the page number to return
The default value is 1
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
The default value is 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters

Gets the Datto BCDR platform activity logs from the past 7 day.
Gets the Datto BCDR platform activity logs for the user named bob from the past 7 day.
Gets the Datto BCDR platform activity logs from the defined targets for the past 30 day.

The Get-DattoApplication cmdlet gets Datto SaaS protection backup data for a given customer

The parameter is mandatory

The parameter is mandatory

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets SaaS protection data about what domains are being protected

maml:description.maml:para: Gets Datto SaaS protection data
The Get-DattoSaaS cmdlet gets Datto SaaS protection data by combing all endpoints into a single command.
This unique function does not contain any BCDR or Reporting endpoints. This function was added to simply testing & generating reports
Returns SaaS protection data about what domains are being protected
Endpoint = /SaaS/domains
Returns SaaS protection seats for a given customer
Endpoint = /SaaS/domains/{sassCustomerId}/seats
Defines the id of the customer to get SaaS information from
The parameter is mandatory
Returns SaaS protection backup data for a given customer
Endpoint = /SaaS/domains/{sassCustomerId}/applications
Defines the id of the customer to get SaaS information from
The parameter is mandatory
Returns SaaS protection data about what domains are being protected
Endpoint = /SaaS/domains
Returns SaaS protection seats for a given customer
Endpoint = /SaaS/domains/{sassCustomerId}/seats
Returns SaaS protection backup data for a given customer
Endpoint = /SaaS/domains/{sassCustomerId}/applications
Defines the id of the customer to get SaaS information from
The parameter is mandatory

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns SaaS protection data about what domains are being protected
This function uses the -endpoint_Domains switch by default
Returns SaaS protection seats for a given customer
Returns SaaS protection backup data for a given customer

maml:description.maml:para: Get Datto SaaS protection seats for a given customer
The Get-DattoSeat cmdlet gets Datto SaaS protection seats for a given customer
Defines the id of the customer to get SaaS information from
The parameter is mandatory
Defines the id of the customer to get SaaS information from
The parameter is mandatory

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the Datto SaaS protection seats from the define customer id
